text.p: A brilliant goal by David Beckham earned Manchester United a 1-1 draw at Chelsea on Saturday and kept the defending champions top of the English premier league.

Second-placed Liverpool could only manage a 0-0 home draw with Blackburn but Newcastle won 1-0 at Middlesbrough to close the gap at the top. United have 54 points to the 53 of Liverpool, with Newcastle third on 48, ahead of Arsenal on goal difference.
Ian Marshall hit a hat-trick in the first 27 minutes to help Leicester to a 4-2 home win over Derby while Sheffield Wednesday came from two down at Southampton to win 3-2.
Leeds won 1-0 at Sunderland while Coventry against Everton and Nottingham Forest against Aston Villa ended goalless.
